input.old_string:
## [1.0.0] - 2025-07-24

### Added
- Google Calendar Group Switcher Chrome extension
- Group management for calendar visibility
  - Create, edit, and delete calendar groups
  - Save multiple calendars as a single group
  - Apply groups to show/hide calendars with one click
- Drag-and-drop interface for reordering groups
- Autocomplete feature for calendar names
- "Show My Calendars Only" quick action button
- Group expand/collapse functionality for viewing members
- Debug information display for troubleshooting
- Chrome storage API integration for persistent data
- Message passing between popup and content scripts
- Support for Google Calendar's checkbox-based calendar selection
- Built with vanilla JavaScript (no framework dependencies)
- Uses Chrome Extension Manifest V3
- Implements content script for DOM manipulation
- Background service worker for tab monitoring
- Asynchronous communication via Chrome messaging API

## [1.0.0] - 2025-07-24

### Added
- Google Calendar Group Switcher Chrome extension
- Group management for calendar visibility
  - Create, edit, and delete calendar groups
  - Save multiple calendars as a single group
  - Apply groups to show/hide calendars with one click
- Drag-and-drop interface for reordering groups
- Autocomplete feature for calendar names
- "Show My Calendars Only" quick action button
- Group expand/collapse functionality for viewing members
- Debug information display for troubleshooting
- Chrome storage API integration for persistent data
- Message passing between popup and content scripts
- Support for Google Calendar's checkbox-based calendar selection
- Built with vanilla JavaScript (no framework dependencies)
- Uses Chrome Extension Manifest V3
- Implements content script for DOM manipulation
- Background service worker for tab monitoring
- Asynchronous communication via Chrome messaging API

# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/ja/1.1.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [1.0.0] - 2025-07-24

### Added
- Google Calendar Group Switcher Chrome extension
- Group management for calendar visibility
  - Create, edit, and delete calendar groups
  - Save multiple calendars as a single group
  - Apply groups to show/hide calendars with one click
- Drag-and-drop interface for reordering groups
- Autocomplete feature for calendar names
- "Show My Calendars Only" quick action button
- Group expand/collapse functionality for viewing members
- Debug information display for troubleshooting
- Chrome storage API integration for persistent data
- Message passing between popup and content scripts
- Support for Google Calendar's checkbox-based calendar selection
- Built with vanilla JavaScript (no framework dependencies)
- Uses Chrome Extension Manifest V3
- Implements content script for DOM manipulation
- Background service worker for tab monitoring
- Asynchronous communication via Chrome messaging API

-- Group expand/collapse functionality for viewing members
-- Chrome storage API integration for persistent data

-- Support for Google Calendar's checkbox-based calendar selection
-- Built with vanilla JavaScript (no framework dependencies)
-- Implements content script for DOM manipulation
-- Background service worker for tab monitoring
-- Asynchronous communication via Chrome messaging API

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
Analysis:
Looking through the conversation chronologically:

1. Initial setup and versioning:
- User started with version 0.8.0 and requested CHANGELOG.md creation
- I updated to version 1.0.0 following Semantic Versioning
- User requested Japanese language for changelog entries
- Created proper versioning guidelines in CLAUDE.md

2. Backup/restore feature implementation:
- User asked about backup/restore functionality for group settings
- I implemented export/import features in popup.js using JSON files
- Updated to version 1.1.0

3. Documentation improvements:
- User requested update methods in README for non-git users
- I reorganized installation/update methods with Git (recommended) and ZIP (non-recommended)
- User provided feedback about settings being lost when reinstalling
- Updated documentation to reflect this reality

4. Error logging system implementation:
- User shifted focus to stability and speed improvements
- Requested comprehensive error logging system
- I implemented global error handlers in all scripts (background.js, popup.js, content.js)
- Added error storage in chrome.storage.local (max 100 entries)
- Created UI for error log display

5. UI simplification:
- User requested removal of debug/error display areas, keeping only clipboard copy functionality
- I simplified UI to just have copy buttons
- User reported "ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼" button not working
- Fixed missing CSS for info-type messages

6. Context menu implementation:
- User reported popup UI not displaying bug
- Requested context menu access to debug/error logs
- I started implementing context menus in background.js
- Added contextMenus and clipboardWrite permissions
- Created offscreen document structure for clipboard operations

The conversation shows iterative development with user feedback driving improvements and bug fixes.

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - Create CHANGELOG.md following Keep a Changelog 1.1 and Semantic Versioning
   - Implement backup/restore functionality for group settings
   - Improve documentation for installation/update methods (especially for non-Git users)
   - Implement comprehensive error logging system for stability and speed improvement investigation
   - Simplify UI by removing display areas and keeping only clipboard copy functionality
   - Add context menu access to debug information and error logs due to popup display issues

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Semantic Versioning (Major.Minor.Patch)
   - Keep a Changelog 1.1 format
   - Chrome Extension Manifest V3
   - Chrome Storage API (chrome.storage.local)
   - Chrome Context Menus API
   - Chrome Offscreen Documents API
   - Global error handlers (window.onerror, unhandledrejection)
   - JSON export/import for settings backup
   - Clipboard API with fallback methods

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - CHANGELOG.md
      - Created to track version history
      - Following Keep a Changelog 1.1 format
      - Japanese language for version descriptions
      ```markdown
      ## [1.2.0] - 2025-07-24

      ### Added
      - ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ­ã‚°åé›†ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ

        - ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚’chrome.storage.localã«æœ€å¤§100ä»¶ã¾ã§ä¿å­˜
      ```

   - manifest.json
      - Version updated from 0.8.0 â†’ 1.0.0 â†’ 1.1.0 â†’ 1.2.0

      ```json
      "permissions": [
        "storage",
        "activeTab",
        "scripting",
        "tabs",
        "contextMenus",
        "clipboardWrite"
      ]
      ```

   - popup.js
      - Added ErrorLogger object for error management
      - Implemented export/import settings functions
      - Added copyErrorLogs function with proper error handling
      ```javascript
      const ErrorLogger = {
        MAX_ERROR_LOGS: 100,
        async saveError(error, context = 'popup') {
          // Error logging implementation
        }
      };
      ```

   - background.js
      - Added global error handlers
      - Implemented context menu creation and handlers
      ```javascript
      chrome.contextMenus.create({
        id: 'copyDebugInfo',
        title: 'ãƒ‡ãƒãƒƒã‚°æƒ…å ±ã‚’ã‚³ãƒ”ãƒ¼',
        contexts: ['action']
      });
      ```

   - popup.css

      ```css
      .message.info {
        background-color: #e8f0fe;
        color: #1a73e8;
        border: 1px solid #4285f4;
        display: block;
      }
      ```

   - offscreen.html
      - Created for clipboard operations from background script
      ```html
      <!DOCTYPE html>
      <html>
      <head>
        <title>Offscreen Document</title>
      </head>
      <body>
        <script src="offscreen.js"></script>
      </body>
      </html>
      ```

4. Errors and fixes:
   - Version numbering confusion:
     - Initially used 0.8.0 for a complete extension
     - Fixed by updating to 1.0.0 for initial stable release
   - Settings loss on reinstallation:
     - User feedback: "å®Ÿéš›ã«ã¯æ‹¡å¼µæ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’èª­ã¿è¾¼ã‚“ã§ã€å†è¿½åŠ ã—ãŸã‚‰ä¿å­˜æ¸ˆã¿ã‚°ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã¯æ¶ˆãˆã¾ã—ãŸ"
     - Fixed documentation to accurately reflect this behavior
   - Error log copy button not working:
     - Missing CSS for info message type
     - Fixed by adding .message.info CSS rules
   - Popup UI not displaying:
     - User reported: "æ‹¡å¼µæ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¦ã‚‚UIãŒè¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œãªã„ãƒã‚°ãŒã‚ã‚‹"
     - Implementing context menu as alternative access method

5. Problem Solving:
   - Solved: Version management system implementation
   - Solved: Backup/restore functionality for settings
   - Solved: Error logging system across all scripts
   - Solved: UI simplification while maintaining functionality
   - Ongoing: Context menu implementation for accessing debug/error logs when popup fails

7. Pending Tasks:
   - Complete offscreen.js implementation for clipboard operations
   - Test context menu functionality
   - Potentially add notification system for successful clipboard operations

8. Current Work:
   I was implementing context menu functionality to allow access to debug information and error logs through right-click on the extension icon. This was in response to the user reporting that the popup UI sometimes doesn't display. I had just:
   - Added contextMenus and clipboardWrite permissions to manifest.json
   - Created context menu items in background.js
   - Implemented handlers for copying debug info and error logs
   - Created offscreen.html file for clipboard operations
   - Was about to create offscreen.js to handle clipboard operations from the background script

9. Optional Next Step:
   Create offscreen.js file to complete the context menu clipboard functionality implementation. This directly continues the work requested by the user: "æ‹¡å¼µæ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã—ã¦ã‚‚UIãŒè¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œãªã„ãƒã‚°ãŒã‚ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ãªã®ã§ã€æ‹¡å¼µæ©Ÿèƒ½ã®å³ã‚¯ãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ã‹ã‚‰ã‚‚ãƒ‡ãƒãƒƒã‚°æƒ…å ±ã‚„ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ­ã‚°ã«ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚»ã‚¹å‡ºæ¥ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã¯å¯èƒ½ã§ã™ã‹ï¼Ÿ".
